moves.1. d4: My ol fav the London Opening
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bf4 h6 4. e3 Bg4: a popular move as pins knight for meanwhile
moves.8... Bxf3: exchange taken but loses a move in the process
moves.10... Bd6 11. Ne5: offers exchage, white never had intention of swaping both knight & bishops
moves.11... Bxe5 12. dxe5 O-O: semi open up a file & pawn puts pressure on row 6
moves.13... Ne7 14. Qg4: looking for quick CM with Bh6
moves.15... Nc5 16. Bxf5: exchange favours white by a pawn
moves.16... exf5 17. Qxf5 Na4: looking to regain pawn on b2
moves.18. Rf2: covers b2 and allows for future rook doubling
moves.21... Qd7: black feels he needs queen, although in hind sight would have been a good option
moves.22. Rd1: loking to force open d file
moves.23. Rxb2 b6 24. Rbd2: looking to rip open D file
moves.24... d4 25. exd4: black should prob take on chin, accept lost pawn and pass to c4
moves.25... cxd4 26. Rd2xd4: attack with rook, even though it leaves isolated pawns, I am not worred about queensdie pawns at this point
moves.28. e6: obstructs queens cover, as pawn is pinned can do little, also frees up diagonal for bishop
moves.28... Rae8: could pass pawn but am looking to close out game
moves.29. Rxf7+ Rxf7: only move on Kg7, Qg6 ,Kh8, Qh7
moves.30. Qxf7+ Kh8: good job pawn freed up angle
